page.title: 09The Offerton Estate.
page.content: The Offerton Estate is a large housing estate built in the late 1960's. It was mainly built by Stockport Council although some homes are now owned by a Housing Association. The houses are known as terraced or town houses.They are built in groups consisting of from 2 to 8 houses, all joined together. They are mostly two storeys high but there are some three.they are placed in so-called neighbourhood blocks and whilst they have a small rear garden there is no front garden.Instead the front doods open onto greens or walkways,some of which are tree lined. Most houses are built to one of four designs.The roofs are tiled,the walls made of pre-formed concrete slbs with some brick.The occupants pay rent to Stockport Council.
